result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra L Schnepp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation can be served in ANY county 
Probation to decide jail term report time/ transfer

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment and comply with any and all recommendations per probation

timeConds.notes:
Jail term is with HUBER privileges and can be served in ANY County 
Probation is to determine whether or not there may be a period of release from jail. 
If Probation allows a period of release it is ordered by the court that it may NOT exceed 30 days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Debra L Schnepp

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM Defendant Debra L Schnepp appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Debra L Schnepp.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives her right to be personlly present in the courtroom. DA Kelz states and agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Contingent upon the Defendant's plea to an Amended Ct. 1 the State will move to Dismiss and Read in the remaining counts. So Ordered. All parties agree to the terms of the agreement. Court questions Attorney Restemayer on preliminary hearing. Attorney Restemayer gives responses and states that the defendant will waive her right to the preliminary hearing. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Court advises DA Kelz to have an Amended information filed. The information is acknowledged by parties and reading waived. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 which has been amended to 961.41(1m)(e) therefore Ct's 2-5 are DISMISSED and READ IN. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties. 

CT.1- Withheld Sentence 
3 Years Probation 
Conditions of probation:
$500 fine 
$250 DNA + Sample 
4 Months conditional time in the Price County Jail w/Huber privileges (Probation and jail term can be served in Ashland County)
The court states probation will be in control of when and how the jail term is served. If probation allows a period of release by order of the court it is not to exceed 30 days
92 Days Sentence Credit 
AODA Assessment 

CT's 2 through 5 - Dismissed and Read In 

Appeal Rights Given
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:05 AM DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Debra L Schnepp appeared by video, in custody. DA Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Debra L Schnepp. Attorney Restemayer states he was unaware that he had been assigned this case and does not know the details of the case. Court comments. Attorney Restemayer takes a moment to look over the criminal complaint on CCAP. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Bond already set and is to continue. So ordered. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for 08/18/2022 at 2:30 PM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

3:56 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant Debra Schnepp appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's next court date is 07/19/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives Defendant a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Court orders a cash bond in the amount of $750 as requested by the State. Defendant questions the court on a signature bond. Court gives responses. Court vacates last order and orders bond in the amount of $250 cash with an additional $500 Signature bond.
